passages.text: Mixed FY25 results - FY26 costs broadly in line but revised Cannington mine plan lowers earnings; retain

Key takeaways: (1) EBITDA was in line with cons / JPMc, while earnings were lower on higher corporate items; 2H DPS of 2.6c was essentially in line, 2) FY26 cost guidance was broadly in line (albeit lower at Worsley), although revisions to Cannington's mine plan (somewhat flagged) have led to lower earnings, and 3) FY27 volume guidance was generally lower than JPMc. Additionally, S32 have cut FY26 capex by \(\sim\) 100m to \(\) 1.4bn\(driven by reductions in aluminium/alumina/Mn. Our FY26 EBITDA moves 7% lower, while our valuation is little changed around\) \ \(3\) ps. We continue to look for a cheaper entry point on the stock to get more constructive and retain our Neutral rating.

Mixed results - EBITDA in line, but NPAT miss. Underlying EBITDA of \(\) 1.9bn\(came in line with JPMc and consensus, however, NPAT was\) 5\% /7\%\$ lower vs JPMc/cons on higher corporate items. Net cash of \(\) 123m\(was\) \ \(30m\) better than our forecast, but fell short of consensus at \(\) 149m\(net cash. The final dividend of 2.6cps (taking the full year dividend to 6cps) was broadly in line. FY26 cost guidance was mixed but evened out from an earnings perspective, with the key drag on our FY26 NPAT related to the revised mine plan at Cannington. FY26 capex has been cut by\) \ \(100m\) to \(\) 1.4bn\(on lower spend at Worsley, GEMCO and Hillside.

Project updates. Worsley production expected to move higher on benefits from improved bauxite supply and development of new mining areas. FY26 volumes are guided at \(5.1M t\) and FY27 at 5.3Mt. Elsewhere, Cannington continues to face challenging ground conditions and, post a review, mining volumes are now expected to remain at 1.8Mtpa over FY26- 31. The company is doing the work to extend mine life via resource to reserve conversion and potential open pit development. At Mozal, discussions are ongoing with the government on electricity supply, without much progress, with S32 planning to put the asset into care and maintenance in Mar 2026, should a suitable agreement not materialise.

Retain Neutral. Our FY26 earnings are down \(9\%\) , largely on Cannington changes. Our NPV is little changed around \(\) 3\(ps post FY26 / 27 guidance. The stock trades at a P/NPV of 0.9x but low FY26 FCF yield of just 1%. We retain neutral rating with a preference for BHP for its diversified mining exposure.

South32 (S32) is a globally diversified mining and metals company headquartered in Perth, Western Australia. Commodities produced include bauxite, alumina, aluminium, copper, silver, lead, zinc, nickel, metallurgical coal and manganese from operations in Australia, South Africa and South America. S32 has a focus on growing its base metal exposure, also holding two development options in North America and several partnerships with junior explorers around the world. We rate S32 Neutral with the stock trading within range of our valuation.
Our Jun- 26 PT is based on our NPV estimate, rounded off to the nearest 10 cents. Our NPV estimate is based on our sum- of- the- parts DCF valuation using an \(8.5\%\) WACC.
